wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Atkinson (6 July 1822 – 15 October 1906) was a pioneer farmer in the Willunga, South Australia and for nine years was a representative for that district in Parliament. In later life he was frequently referred to as "Captain Atkinson".

response: *Thomas Atkinson (bishop) (1807–1881), third Episcopal Bishop of the Diocese of North Carolina
*Thomas Atkinson (priest) (died 1616), English Roman Catholic priest and martyr
*Thomas Atkinson (Royal Navy officer) (1767–1836), Master of HMS Victory at the Battle of Trafalgar
*Thomas Atkinson (Wisconsin politician) (1928–1988), mayor of Green Bay, Wisconsin
*Thomas Atkinson (poet) (1801–1833), Scottish poet and miscellaneous writer
*Thomas Atkinson (Australian politician) (1822–1906), politician in South Australia

response: : Noarlunga MHA John Colton resigned on 29 August 1878. Thomas Atkinson won the resulting by-election on 14 September.
